etymologies: late 17th century: via Latin from Greek narthēx

definitions: an antechamber, porch, or distinct area at the western entrance of some early Christian churches, separated off by a railing and used by catechumens, penitents, etc.
shortDefinitions: antechamber, porch, or distinct area at western entrance of some early Christian churches

definitions: an antechamber or large porch in a modern church.
shortDefinitions: antechamber or large porch in modern church
